snippet: The organization’s theory is that the more efficiently food is used in the developed world, the more food will be available for the developing world.
abstract: Oxfam says that it wants American women to think more about the impact their families' eating habits have on the environment and people in parts of the world where food is less abundant; advocates small changes in shopping, cooking and eating that could lead to positive changes in the global food chain.
lead_paragraph: The organization’s theory is that the more efficiently food is used in the developed world, the more food will be available for the developing world.

headline.seo: Oxfam Campaign Encourages U.S. Women to Use Food Efficiently
headline.main: Oxfam Urges U.S. Women to Pursue Efficiency in Food Use
headline.print_headline: Oxfam Urges U.S. Women to Pursue Efficiency in Food Use
